explanation: Agent A is correct. In the provided build configuration LFS_UNLOCK expands to ((void)cfg), i.e. an expression statement that has no observable side‑effects (it merely evaluates and discards the value of cfg). Removing that statement would not change the program behaviour (except for an almost‑inevitable negligible timing difference), so the statement meets the definition of dead code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. Caveat: if the evaluation of cfg had observable side effects (e.g. cfg is volatile or its evaluation triggers hardware effects), or if very small timing differences are considered part of the required behaviour in this system, then the statement would not be dead; no such evidence is present in the scenario, so the reported violation is correct.
